Becoming a Sublime (Text) Ninja

10 May 2013 โดย

With Sublime Text 2, I can forget about trying vim, textmate. To utilize the full power of sublime, we need to setup some stuffs and install extensions.

Setting up for command line

If you haven’t add ~/bin to your path, then add.

echo 'export PATH=~/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.profile

Then

defaults write ~/.MacOSX/environment EDITOR "~/bin/subl -w "

Sync Sublime Options

Modified from Roland Warmerdam’s Blog

In other computer cd ln -s ~/Dropbox/Apps/sublime2/settings/ “Sublime Text 2”

Power features

  • Project
  • Multiple cursors
  • Useful shortkeys

Options

{ "color_scheme": "Packages/Color Scheme - Default/Monokai.tmTheme", "font_size": 12.0, "highlight_line": true, "ignored_packages": [], "indent_guide_options": [ "draw_normal", "draw_active" ], "tab_size": 2, "translate_tabs_to_spaces": true, "trim_trailing_white_space_on_save": true, // good practice to always remove trailing spaces "word_wrap": "true" }

Shortkeys

The default short keys that comes with Sublime Text 2 are great. But there are some useful addition that I think it is helpful as well.

[ { "keys": ["cmd+alt+r"], "command": "reindent" , "args": {"single_line": false}} , { "keys": ["cmd+shift+k"], "command": "run_macro_file", "args": {"file": "Packages/Default/Delete Line.sublime-macro"} } , { "keys": ["super+alt+f"], "command": "show_panel", "args": {"panel": "find"} } , { "keys": ["super+f"], "command": "show_panel", "args": {"panel": "replace"} } , { "keys": ["ctrl+shift+t"], "command": "delete_trailing_spaces" } ]

Theme

Sublime has a lot of theme, I prefer Tomorrow-Night.

Plugins

Install Package Control  first. Then you can easily install any of the following good plugins:

  • General Purpose

    • SublimeCodeIntel – super cool autocompletion

    • AllAutoComplete – extend sublime autocomplete to check all opened files.

    • Alignment

    • BracketHighlighter

    • Sidebar Enhancement - many cool add-ons to the sidebar.

    • EasyMotion super fast navigation with cmd+;+<character-to-jump-to>–a super plugin inspired from Vim

    • sublimelinter – Great for checking syntax errors and warning for most popular languages

    • ...

Getting start with my mac like a Pro

02 Jun 2012 โดย

Setting up a new computer takes time since we need to put all great tools and configs into the computer. Having a list is useful and here is my list.

OSX Settings

  • Mouse Setting - Go to System Preference > Trackpad - then enable “Tap to click” and “3 Finger Drag”
  • Show Hidden Files
  • Keyboard Shortcuts–One great thing about mac setting is you
  • alt – alt + - = –, alt + = = ≠, alt + < = ≤, alt + > = ≥

Installing and Setting up Apps

Manually Downloaded

Productivity (Daily Use)

  • Chrome – is my #1 browser (My List of Plugins coming soon!)

  • Firefox – for rendering some web that’s bad in Chrome and, of course, for testing.

  • Dropbox & Google Drive – for syncing files

  • Alfred – help me Launch Apps faster (I replace Quicksilver with Alfred)

  • Growl – for many notification

  • Fluid App - Create Application file for your favorite web apps so that you can easily click them from the dock and have their own windows and tabs. Each “app” created also have their own bookmark, which is very helpful Use http://iconverticons.com to create icons for an app you like! - I use fluid app to create apps for Github and Twitter Bootstrap.

  • SecondBar - Duplicate Menubar to your second screen. (ALERT! Somehow this app interferes with SublimeText2)

Productivity (Good to have)

  • NTFS Write support – very important if you have NTFS hard drives

  • CoBook – better address book, (Killer Feature: able to sync with Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter.)

  • ...
